title: Retry deployment by fixing repository and build configuration issues

requirements.text: Identify the root cause of the previous Internet Computer deployment failure ("Unable to complete deployment") by capturing the full build/deploy logs and making the minimal code/config changes needed so a clean deploy succeeds.
acceptanceCriteria: A deployment attempt produces a complete, readable error log in the build output (not only a generic failure message).
After fixes, the project deploys successfully to the network without manual intervention beyond the standard deploy command used by the platform.
No new product features are added as part of the fix; changes are limited to build/deploy correctness and stability.

requirements.text: Add a lightweight preflight validation step to the project build that checks for required Internet Computer project files/configuration and fails with clear English messages when prerequisites are missing or inconsistent.
acceptanceCriteria: If required configuration/artifacts are missing (e.g., canister/build config), the build fails early with a clear English error that states what is missing and how to resolve it.
If prerequisites are present, the preflight step does not alter behavior and the build proceeds normally.
User-facing error/output text introduced by this step is in English.

constraints: Keep all backend logic in a single Motoko actor (backend/main.mo) if backend changes are required.
Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui or other immutable paths defined by the template.
Use English for any user-facing text produced by build scripts or UI changes related to this request.
nonGoals: Adding new assistant features (chat commands, new UI panels, new integrations).
Changing the app‚Äôs visual theme or branding assets.
Introducing external databases, third-party auth providers, or non-Motoko backend services.
